page.title: 13Churches
page.content: To the West of Felton is the Church of St.Michael's and All Angels. There is no spire or tower but one tall western wall in which hangs the bell. The church is built on a Saxon site and the Chancel is said to have been built in the 13th century although the Old Vicarage was much younger. The new vicarage is in the new estate, Benlaw Grove to the North of the village. Further west is a small private Roman Catholic chapel next to Felton Park built in 1857. It was rededicated in 1983.The priest travels from a nearby village to take public services.South of the Coquet up a steep footpath is the old Presbyterian Church built in 1820. The present church was built in 1924. The new Manse will be in Benlaw Grove. On the main street there was a Methodist Chapel. This is now being converted into a house.
